That sounds like an amazing surfing trip! Congrats on catching some waves!

Now, let's get you prepared for your Rocky Mountains adventure! July is a great time to visit the Rockies, with warm weather and long days. Here's what you can expect:

**Temperature:**

* Daytime temperatures in July usually range from the mid-70s to mid-80s Fahrenheit (23-30°C) in the lower elevations (below 8,000 ft).
* At higher elevations (above 8,000 ft), daytime temperatures can be 10-15°F (5-8°C) cooler.
* Nighttime temperatures can drop significantly, even in the summer, so be prepared for temperatures ranging from 50°F to 60°F (10-15°C).

**Precipitation:**

* July is typically a dry month in the Rocky Mountains, with an average of 1-2 inches (2.5-5 cm) of precipitation throughout the month.
* Afternoon thunderstorms are common in the Rockies during the summer, so be prepared for occasional rain showers.

**Other Weather Conditions:**

* Humidity is usually relatively low in the Rockies, ranging from 30-50%.
* UV radiation is high at high elevations, so don't forget your sunscreen, sunglasses, and a hat.
* Wind can be a factor, especially in the afternoons, so pack layers and be prepared for gusty conditions.

**Regional Variations:**

* The weather can vary depending on the specific location within the Rocky Mountains. For example:
	+ The southern Rockies (e.g., Colorado, New Mexico) tend to be warmer and drier than the northern Rockies (e.g., Montana, Wyoming).
	+ The higher elevations (e.g., above 10,000 ft) will be cooler and potentially snowier than the lower elevations.

To get more specific weather forecasts, I recommend checking websites like:

1. National Weather Service (NWS): [www.weather.gov](http://www.weather.gov)
2. OpenSnow: [www.opensnow.com](http://www.opensnow.com) (for mountain weather forecasts)
3. Mountain-forecast.com: [www.mountain-forecast.com](http://www.mountain-forecast.com)

Enter the specific location you plan to visit, and you'll get a more detailed forecast. You can also check the weather forecast closer to your trip to get the most up-to-date information.

Get ready for an epic adventure in the Rocky Mountains!
